text: The inventor of vaseline ate a spoonful every day.
Sloths can take up to a month to digest a single meal.
A cheetah can accelerate faster than most sports cars.
The mantis shrimp has 16 color receptors compared to our 3.
Helium makes up 24% of the mass of the universe.
The Mariana Trench is deeper than Mount Everest is tall.
Water can boil and freeze at the same time at the right conditions.
The word 'nerd' was first coined by Dr. Seuss.
Cats spend 70% of their lives sleeping.
The Moon is moving away from Earth at 3.8 cm per year.
Bees can see ultraviolet light that humans cannot.
The longest time between twin births is 87 days.
A single sneeze can contain up to 40,000 droplets.
The world's oldest piece of chewing gum is 9,000 years old.
A tarantula can survive for two years without food.
The average human body contains enough carbon to make 900 pencils.
Saturn's rings are mostly made of ice particles.
A hummingbird weighs less than a nickel.
The Sahara Desert was once a tropical rainforest.
Sharks can detect a drop of blood from miles away.
The fingerprints of koalas are almost identical to human fingerprints.
A group of kangaroos is called a mob.
The world's largest flower is the Rafflesia, which smells like rotting flesh.
Honey has been found in ancient Egyptian tombs that is still edible.
The average person spends 6 months of their life waiting at red lights.
A group of goldfish is called a troubling.
The human brain is about 75% water.
Venus is the only planet that spins clockwise.
The world's largest volcano is underwater.
A group of butterflies is called a kaleidoscope.
The Amazon River dolphin is pink.
The Leaning Tower of Pisa took 199 years to build.
A group of frogs is called an army.
The world's smallest country is Vatican City.
The average person has about 100,000 hairs on their head.
A dolphin can swim and sleep at the same time.
The world's first computer programmer was a woman named Ada Lovelace.
A cockroach can survive for weeks without its head.
The human body produces about 1.5 liters of saliva per day.
A group of whales is called a pod.
The Titanic was carrying 12 dogs, 3 of which survived.
The world's longest river is the Nile.
A group of crocodiles is called a bask.
The human heart creates enough pressure to squirt blood 30 feet.
The world's largest desert is Antarctica.
A group of eagles is called a convocation.
The human brain can survive for 5-10 minutes without oxygen.
The world's tallest mammal is the giraffe.
A group of fish is called a school.
The human body contains about 206 bones.
The world's fastest bird is the peregrine falcon.
A group of geese is called a gaggle.
The human eye can distinguish about 10 million colors.
The world's largest animal is the blue whale.
A group of lions is called a pride.
The human body is about 60% water.
The world's fastest land animal is the cheetah.
A group of wolves is called a pack.
The human brain weighs about 3 pounds.
The world's largest bird is the ostrich.
A group of ants is called a colony.
The human heart beats about 100,000 times per day.
The world's largest reptile is the saltwater crocodile.
A group of bees is called a swarm.
The human body has about 640 muscles.
The world's smallest bird is the bee hummingbird.
A group of dolphins is called a pod.
The human skin is the largest organ in the body.
The world's fastest fish is the sailfish.
A group of sharks is called a shiver.
The human skeleton makes up about 15% of body weight.
The world's longest snake is the reticulated python.
A group of crows is called a murder.
The human liver performs over 500 different functions.
The world's heaviest insect is the Goliath beetle.
A group of owls is called a parliament.
The human small intestine is about 20 feet long.
The world's longest insect is the Chan's megastick.
A group of penguins is called a colony.
The human tongue has about 10,000 taste buds.
The world's most venomous spider is the Brazilian wandering spider.
A group of hippos is called a bloat.
The human nose can detect about 1 trillion scents.
The world's loudest animal is the blue whale.
A group of elephants is called a herd.
The human ear can hear frequencies from 20 Hz to 20,000 Hz.
The world's fastest marine animal is the black marlin.
A group of zebras is called a dazzle.
The human eye blinks about 15-20 times per minute.
The world's largest land animal is the African elephant.
A group of turtles is called a bale.
The human body produces about 1 liter of mucus per day.
The world's smallest frog is the Paedophryne amauensis.
A group of toads is called a knot.
The human body has about 2.5 million sweat glands.
The world's deepest lake is Lake Baikal.
A group of squirrels is called a scurry.
The human body replaces all its cells every 7-10 years.
The world's tallest waterfall is Angel Falls.
A group of monkeys is called a troop.
